definitions.text: a journey in a vehicle (usually an automobile)
examples: he took the family for a drive in his new car

definitions.text: a mechanical device that you ride for amusement or excitement
sit and travel on the back of animal, usually while controlling its motions
examples: She never sat a horse!
Did you ever ride a camel?
The girl liked to drive the young mare

definitions.text: be carried or travel on or in a vehicle
examples: I ride to work in a bus
He rides the subway downtown every day
Let it ride
The moon rode high in the night sky

definitions.text: harass with persistent criticism or carping
examples: The children teased the new teacher
Don't ride me so hard over my failure
His fellow workers razzed him when he wore a jacket and tie

definitions.text: be sustained or supported or borne
examples: His glasses rode high on his nose
The child rode on his mother's hips
She rode a wave of popularity
The brothers rode to an easy victory on their father's political name
This car rides smoothly
My new truck drives well
The outcomes rides on the results of the election
Your grade will depends on your homework
Ship rides at anchor

definitions.text: sit on and control a vehicle
examples: He rides his bicycle to work every day
She loves to ride her new motorcycle through town
Shorts that ride up
This skirt keeps riding up my legs
Ride the freeways of California

definitions.text: keep partially engaged by slightly depressing a pedal with the foot
examples: Don't ride the clutch!
The bull was riding the cow
